title.narrative: OUTPUT 5.1: HIV POLICY, STRAT, COORD

description.narrative: By 2020, competent authorities have the capacity to develop and coordinate evidence-based national policies and strategies on HIV and adolescent and youth health and skills development., which contributes to Adolescents And Hiv/Aids, Care And Treatment Of Children Affected By Hiv And Aids, Hiv Prevention, Hiv â€“ General, Pmtct And Infant Male Circumcision, Protect, Care And Support Children And Families Affected By Hiv, Treatment And Care Of Children Living With Hiv. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2020 women, children and adolescent, especially the most vulnerable, use equitable and quality HIV services

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2020, competent authorities have the capacity to develop and coordinate evidence-based national policies and strategies on HIVand adolescent and youth health and skills development.

description.narrative: In 2020, the Country Office helped strengthen the coordination and ownership of national and regional authorities relative to HIV, adolescent health, and skill development. The Country Office also supported the development of key strategic documents, including: the 2021-2025 National Strategic Plan against HIV, AIDS, and STIs; the draft 2021-2025 National Youth Policy; and the COVID-19 HIV Contingency Response Plan. | Status:Met | As-of Date:27/01/2021
